Articles.Content:
So admittedly this isnt the worst bug in the world, but on this lander (craft file w/ launch vehicle: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/arg1kkd8nzwoc8x/Orion.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/arg1kkd8nzwoc8x/Orion.craft?dl=0) ) mining fills up the ore tanks instantaneously. I use action groups for mining (1 lowers drill, 2 starts surface harvester, 3 stops surface harvester). The instant i press "2" the tanks go from 0 to full, and as much as i love getting 10,500 ore in a fraction of a second it seems wrong.

KSP 1.0.2

windows 7 64 bit

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-20T05:13:52Z" title="06/20/2015 05:13  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 20, 2015</time> by jkool702**

I have exactly the same bug:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123946-BIG-FAT-BUG-Ore-containers-filling-emptying-instantly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123946-BIG-FAT-BUG-Ore-containers-filling-emptying-instantly)

This sounds like the same problem, except (thankfully) my ore tanks dont empty when I redock. Maybe this has to do with the fact that the ISRU is on the lander itself?

Also, the steps on your thred arent a foolproof way to reproduce that. I also have a refinery in Minimus orbit and followed those exact steps and dont have a problem, my lander that has an issue is attached to an interplanetary ship...

Meanwhile, i made another miner with 2x large ore container, same problem.

Also, same problem at Pol.
This problem seems to have fixed itself for my lander....very strange bug indeed

Im not sure....it just seemed to fix itself for whatever reason

EDIT: so far today it has started happening again and then sopped happening yet again. I have no idea what triggers it to start or stop....
